title:
makeSomethingAsync().
  .then(() => foo('unexpectedValue'))
  .catch(err => console.log(err)) // <-- Error: UnexpectedValue will be caught here

content_resolved.code:
makeSomethingAsync().
  .then(() => foo('unexpectedValue'))
  .catch(err => console.log(err)) // <-- Error: UnexpectedValue will be caught here

title: However, if the same function is called outside of a promise chain, then the error will not be handled by it and will be thrown to the application:

inline_content.Text: However, if the same function is called outside of a promise chain, then the error will not be handled by it and will be thrown to the application:

title:
foo('unexpectedValue') // <-- error will be thrown, so the application will crash
  .then(makeSomethingAsync) // <-- will not run
  .catch(err => console.log(err)) // <-- will not catch

content_resolved.code:
foo('unexpectedValue') // <-- error will be thrown, so the application will crash
  .then(makeSomethingAsync) // <-- will not run
  .catch(err => console.log(err)) // <-- will not catch
